newsitem.title: SWEDEN: LITHUANIA-MINISTRY CONSIDERS ONLY ONE EUROBOND IN 1997.
newsitem.headline: LITHUANIA-MINISTRY CONSIDERS ONLY ONE EUROBOND IN 1997.

text.p: The Lithuanian finance ministry is considering the issue of just one eurobond this year rather than the two it has said it may launch, a senior finance ministry official said on Wednesday.
The country has already said it intends to launch a $200 million deal later this year.

"There is a good chance we might only issue one bond this year," Ruta Skyriene of the finance ministry's international department told Reuters at a conference on investing in the Baltic states, organised by Euromoney, in the Swedish capital.
She said the ministry was working on a medium-term borrowing policy, which had the goal of reducing debt.
This policy may also involve the reduction of the number of state guarantees issued for loans taken by state entities.
